> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/gladiator/files/SCEN116.gif 

ok, here's how my radar function treats Scenario #116 with Advanced
Thumbnail.  Ok, here's the legend for the picture:

1)large size circles with black dots in them are teleporters
2)medium size circles are characters stored in the map, color
indicates which team they belong to
3)small circles are player start positions on the map, color indicates
which team
4)big squares represent doors, color indicating which team can pass
through
5)small squares represent trees, color indiciating which team can pass
through
6)diamons (yes, those are supposed to be diamonds) indicate generators
(when I can find any easy way to fill the area inside them with a
color, color will indicate which team they belong to)
7)tall boxes represent some treasures: gold and silver bars, all the
various potions, and drumstick (color indicates which type of object -
I'm sticking really close to the original object here)

*scratches head to see if there is anything else worth mentioning*

Oh yea, jpg format produced a larger file size than gif plus it didn't
look as good imo so that's why I choose to display this image in gif.
 The original file size in BMP was 901 kb.

Oh yea, this thumbnail radar view is 1/16th the size of the real map.
 So if things look off-centered, I'm going to blame some unavoidable
rounding errors for figuring out exactly where things go on a map.

I'm looking for feedback on some of my choices I made for how to
represent things (I varied a lot in some aspects from the original
programming for handling different objects on the radar) and any
suggestions for making things better.

Oh well, I'm off to figure out the most effective way to blood stains
on the map as well as keys and exits.  Did I mention putting something
to mark where blood is on the map?

When I get through with the Advanced Thumbnail function, I'll update
Jesse again.
